mapper.sql: a.id, a.office_id AS "office.id", a.name, a.enname, a.role_type AS roleType, a.type AS type, a.remarks, a.create_by AS "createBy.id", a.create_date, a.update_by AS "updateBy.id", a.update_date, a.useable AS useable, a.is_sys AS sysData
mapper.select: SELECT , rm.menu_id AS "menuList.id", rd.datarule_id AS "dataRuleList.id" FROM sys_role a LEFT JOIN sys_role_menu rm ON rm.role_id = a.id LEFT JOIN sys_role_datarule rd ON rd.role_id = a.id WHERE a.id = #{id}
mapper.insert: INSERT INTO sys_role( id, office_id, name, enname, type, role_type, create_by, create_date, update_by, update_date, remarks, del_flag, is_sys, useable ) VALUES ( #{id}, #{office.id}, #{name}, #{enname}, #{type}, #{roleType}, #{createBy.id}, #{createDate}, #{updateBy.id}, #{updateDate}, #{remarks}, #{delFlag}, #{sysData}, #{useable} )
mapper.update: UPDATE sys_role SET office_id = #{office.id}, name = #{name}, enname = #{enname}, role_type = #{roleType}, type = #{type}, update_by = #{updateBy.id}, update_date = #{updateDate}, remarks = #{remarks}, is_sys = #{sysData}, useable = #{useable} WHERE id = #{id}
